text: well hi everyone
hear the internet's busiest music nerd
and it's time for a review of this new
wise blood album and in the darkness
Hearts aglow this is a brand new LP from
singer and songwriter Natalie Maring AKA
wiseblood whose recent forays into more
of a baroque Pop Style led to this
project getting more attention and
acclaim than it ever has in 2019 she
reached a beautiful peak of artistry
with this sound on the record Titanic
Rising not just one of the best albums
of that year but one of the prettiest
albums of the decade so of course I'm
excited to hear a follow-up also excited
to hear that Natalie is more or less
doubling down on this sound with this LP
with sparkling and shimmering beds of
pianos strings and guitar that sound
like they are straight out of the 70s
obviously making familiar nods to
influences that were pretty prominent on
the last LP like Joni Mitchell and it's
also not surprising to see names and
faces like Jonathan rado in the mix on
the production end not just because of
the fact that he was involved in the
last LP but his track record with
helping other musicians pull from this
era as well Father John Misty being one
now just like with Titanic Rising hearts
of glow is a pretty standard 10 track
experience with an interlude or two
Landing within that 40 to 50 minute
range really feels like Natalie is
digging for gold in pretty much the same
spot all over again and I would say her
labor is mostly fruitful given some of
the great highlights here there's
children of the Empire which is a jaunty
piano ballad loaded with beautiful
Melodies and string work a lot of
compositional Peaks too like the organ
arpeggios that pop in or the Russia's
vocal harmonies that hit here and there
the big finish toward the end where
Natalie shows off her vocal chops a
little bit as well as the little Baroque
string outro all fantastic the worst is
done is a smooth and cheeky Bittersweet
reflection on the hell the world has
gone through over the past several years
really since the last wise blood record
some would say at this point the worst
is done as she says in the track but she
does not agree she thinks it it's just
kind of getting started which frankly I
think is the more sensible position to
take at this point I also think the line
where she says she didn't think we'd all
lean into hyper isolation that's one of
the most shocking bits and realizations
on this entire record God turned me into
a flower was another highlight for me
which I thought was an ambient pop
stunner where Natalie Spotlight vocals
soar over these droning synthscapes
there's lots of meditative repetitive
leads and building harmonies not exactly
the direct and tuneful experience of
many songs from the last LP some of the
best highlights from this LP but still
show-stopping in its own way especially
with its effect heavy outro that makes
the whole song sound like it's taking
place in some kind of dream rainforest
and while starting in a more formal song
fashion the track hearts of glow also
hits a really hypnotic stride the longer
it goes on the more it builds and the
more entrancing it all becomes the major
fault of this LP overall that I found is
that Natalie doesn't really bring her
best crop of songs even if the
production on the record is consistently
impressive from track to track to track
the opener on on the lp I think has a
pretty strong beginning between its
beckoning vocals and simple pianos
there's an earnestness to it that I
enjoy a lot along the lines of John
Lennon's imagine but the song structure
from here leaves a lot to be desired
because we kind of hear a lot of
variations on this part a section but
not really a Part B that contrasts or
transitions hard enough that it feels
like the song is actually progressing
opting instead for widening the
instrumental palette and kind of coming
up with some background variations here
and there which is a strategy but in my
opinion not enough of a change up to
make this track worth the length that it
lasts meanwhile Grapevine is a more
acoustic driven cut with some pretty
touches of bells and scents here and
there some overpowering strings too it's
a lot to pull apart but honestly the
vocal Melodies that Natalie brings to
the table are kind of the last thing on
my mind like at this track we're
completely stripped back would I be as
enamored with it as I am with uh all of
its layers intact not really then
there's twin flame which is maybe the
biggest head scratcher on the entire LP
because goes between its thin guitars
its drum machines and layers of
atmosphere it kind of just sounds like a
bad Beach House impression and not so
bad that it's unlistenable but it does
feel like it's falling short of
something that it's obviously trying to
copy then there's the closer a given
thing which is a more of a meditative
cut than it is a proper song and in my
opinion sort of an unearned one because
it's not like the track list has been
wall to wall bangers up until this point
I don't know what it is exactly that we
need to you know tone things down and
get really repetitive to reflect on for
sure lyrically speaking I do appreciate
the way the track ties up some of its
themes of love but outside of those
comments I don't really get too much
more out of the track for me this wise
blood record while it is as impressive
as Titanic rising in many respects I
just don't think it really brought
everything it could on the songwriting
front the record does bring good
production and performances to the table
as well as some interesting lyrics and
themes of course some great highlights
as well but the focus and dynamics of
the songs was at the core of all these
tracks just vary too much in quality
across the record you really don't know
what you're getting from track to track
kind of jumps around a bit too much you
could get a stellar ballad with lavish
Baroque instrumentation lots of cool
lyrical and instrumental highlights that
pop off throughout but then there's
other cuts that feel like
one-dimensional meditations that get old
very fast at best they're kind of
pleasant while they're on and while
that's not the worst thing this record
could be it just doesn't really put it
on the level of Titanic rising in my
opinion I'm feeling a light to decent
seven on this one transition have you
given this record to listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best or the best what
should I review next hit the like if you
like Please Subscribe and please don't
cry hit the Bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel Anthony fantana
wise blood
forever
